sources.full: Trip trough the cosmos - Monk Subclasses

subclass.name: Way of the Ancient Roots
subclassFeatures: Way of the Ancient Roots|Monk||Ancient Roots|Cos|3

subclassFeature.name: Way of the Ancient Roots
entries: Monks who follow the way of the Ancient Roots understand that Ki is not an exclusive thing to monks, every living organism has Ki flowing trough them, from a small flower to an gigant owlbear. All monks can stop the flow of Ki in other creatures, such as with the Stunning Strike technic, but only the Ancient Roots allows the monk to use its Ki to interact with anothers creatures flow.

subclassFeature.name: Gardening Magic
entries: As you enter this subclass you gain the ability to cast spells to do this you may use plants or fungi as your casting focus, we call this a Plant Focus to simplify. The main difference of a Plant Focus and your normal focus is the ability to extend the range of given abilities. As you touch a plant you may choose to cast a spell right from where your hand is touching the plant or from a distant branch. Using this feature you may extend the range of you cantrips and Flow Technics up to 150ft.
A plant focus may be: seeds, spores, mushrooms, small plants, bushes, trees, etc...

Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for your monk spells. You use your Wisdom whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Wisdom modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a monk spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one. In addition, you use your Wisdom modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a druid spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

subclassFeature.name: Magic Stick & Cantrips
entries: At level 3 you gain knowledge of the {@spell monk's shillelagh|Cos} cantrip and two more cantrips from the {@filter druid spell list|spells|class=druid}, you may use a Plant Focus to cast this spells. You may change your cantrips every time you level up on this class.

subclassFeature.name: Flow Technics
entries: Your understanding of Ki flow has reached a point that allows you to make more than grow small flowers. You learn {@filter Flow Technics|optionalfeatures|feature type=ft|source=Cos} which allow you to mold plants in ways you would have never imagined.
{@filter Flow Technics|optionalfeatures|feature type=ft|source=Cos} are a mix of spellcasting and battle maneuvers, this mix allows for a tactital deployment of magical plants against enemies.

{@filter Flow Technics|optionalfeatures|feature type=ft|source=Cos} require a Plant Focus to cast and use your wisdom modifier for damage. Technics are affected by spells such as {@spell dispel magic} and {@spell counterpell} dispelling any plant creation.
{@b Technic Stacking:} Some technics can be stacked which means that can be casted mutiple times in the same action.
Example: You may want to hit a creature 60Ft. from you using {@b Extending Vines}. You are able to hit it if you stack the technic: using 2 Ki but only 1 bonus action.
Technics that can be stacked will have the 'Stackable' property and can be done so up to a maximum equal to your wisdom modifier per action.

items: {@i 'Casting'} trough magical plants may present the player with unforeseen magical effects.
Giving your player magical plants instead of weapons may be an interesting idea to explore.
A player may try to 'make' it's weapon, i do recommend you and the player read a bit about plant grafting.

Open battles with grass on the ground present this subclass with an unparalleled range at such low levels (180ft. if you use {@b Caltrops's Spines}), this may become a headache or a way for players to express their creativity.

subclassFeature.name: Flow Begginer
entries: You learn {@b Entangle} and {@b Extending Vines} from the {@filter Flow Technics|optionalfeatures|feature type=ft|source=Cos} list.

subclassFeature.name: Fury of Sticks
entries: You may use a weapon created wih {@spell monk's shillelagh|Cos} instead of unarmed strikes when you hit with Fury of Blows and if you used a flow technic as your action you may use fury of blows as your bonus action.

subclassFeature.name: Aprentice of Flow
entries: You learn {@b Dust Mushroom}, {@b Beetlebomber's Fire Flowers}, {@b Fruity Explotion} and {@b Caltrops's Spines} from the {@filter Flow Technics|optionalfeatures|feature type=ft|source=Cos} list.

subclassFeature.name: Master of Flow
entries: You learn {@b Cultivate}, {@b Leaf Baloon}, {@b Green Fist} and {@b Wall of Plants} from the {@filter Flow Technics|optionalfeatures|feature type=ft|source=Cos} list.

subclassFeature.name: Flow Expert
entries: You learn {@b Ancient Flow} and {@b Last Meal} from the {@filter Flow Technics|optionalfeatures|feature type=ft|source=Cos} list.

spell.name: Monk's Shillelagh

components.m: A piece of a living plant or a fresh seed

entries: The piece of plant or seed you are holding grows in interaction with your Ki into a quarterstaff. For the duration, you can use your spellcasting ability instead of Strength or Dexterity for the attack and damage rolls of melee attacks using that weapon, and the weapon's damage die becomes a d6.
The staff is considered alive and the spell ends if it dies, the spell also ends if you cast it again.
Your magical staff damage increases when you reach 5th level ({@damage 1d8}), 11th level ({@damage 1d10}), and 17th level ({@damage 1d12}).

optionalfeature.name: Extending Vines
entries: Vines extend from your focus and transmit your Ki flow. You may extend the Range of any technic for 30Ft. Extending a technic adds no action time.

You may also use this technic as a ranged weapon attack, 30Ft. for Martial Arts Dice + wisdom modifier magical piercing damage. This cost 1 Bonus Action. Can also be used to pull/push/hold on to things or make an improvised rope.
Vines can pass trough a hole an inch in diameter and live for a day before driying up and dying.

optionalfeature.name: Entangle
entries: You throw a seed to a point 30ft. from you. Grasping weeds and vines sprout from the ground in a 10-foot radius starting from the seed. For the duration, these plants turn the ground in the area into difficult terrain for creatures other than you.

A creature in the area when you cast the technic must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be restrained by the entangling plants until the technic ends. A creature restrained by the plants can use its action to make a Strength check against your spell save DC. On a success, it frees itself.
If you loose concentration or the technic ends all creatures are set free, but the plants live for a day before drying up and dying.

optionalfeature.name: Caltrops's Spines
entries: You grow a pod of caltrop's fruits, as you touch it the pod opens and the covered in spines seeds fly away. Make a ranged weapon attack, the damage is your Martial Arts Dice + wisdom modifier magical piercing damage.

optionalfeature.name: Dust Mushroom
entries: You throw a handfull of spores into a point 30ft. from you, a dark grey puffball mushroom with a spherical tip grows from the bag. It explodes making a dense cloud 10Ft. in radius of dark spores, which is iritating to the eyes. Creatures in this area can't see, except by wearing some eye protection.

The spores are extremly flamable any contact with fire will light them up, and any creature in the area takes your Martial Arts Dice as magic fire damage. This also removes the spore cloud. This damage is not stackable with multiple casts of {@b Dust Mushroom}.

optionalfeature.name: Fruity Explotion
entries: You throw a seed to a point 30ft. from you. A giant palm fruit grows from the seed in the middle of the battle, as it grows the explotion is inminent. Every creature in a 20ft cone must succed a dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC or be covered in fruit juice. A creature covered in the juices may use its action to clean it in any way it has. If the creature doesn't clean the juices it must succed a dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC every time it decides to start to move or be nocked prone and loose all movement left.

The juice is flamable, a creature set a flame recieves your Martial Arts Dice as magic fire damage at the start of every turn for a minute or till extinguished. The fire damage it's not stackable if you splash a creature with more juice or oil.

optionalfeature.name: Beetlebomber's Fire Flowers
entries: You grow 2 flowers in your hand, as they touch each other they react. A hot spray of chemicals covers a 10ft. cone, every creature must succed a dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC or takes your Martial Arts Dice + wisdom magic fire damage. If a creature succeds it takes half the damage rounded down.
The damage increases at level 11 to 2 times your Martial Arts Dice + wisdom modifier
The damage increases at level 17 to 3 times your Martial Arts Dice + wisdom modifier

optionalfeature.name: Leaf Baloon
entries: You create a sphere of silky white leaves, it rapidly bulks up as it becomes filled with air, and starts to slowly float upwards, a maximum of 2 medium creatures or 1 large creature can hold to it and float upwards at a velocity of 15ft. per round. Having multiple {@b Leaf Baloons} stacks the floating velocity.
A Huge creature may float upwards at a speed of 15ft. per round with 4 flowers.

optionalfeature.name: Green Fist
entries: You summon a {@creature Green Fist|Cos} made of veiny wood, roots and leaves. You may immediately use the Green Fist's {@b Nature's Force} attack.
You may move the fist & make another attack using your bonus action, to do so spend 1 Ki point (You don't need to touch the fist for this).
After the duration the fist dries up and dies.

optionalfeature.name: Wall of Plants
entries: Wood and branches erupt from plant you are touching creating a wall of plant mush. You may create a 20ft. long, 10ft. tall and 5ft. width wall. You may instead create an object with eight connected 5 foot cubes or a 10 foot diameter sphere.
If you are planning to trap a creature inside a sphere, it must make a dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC, on a fail it becomes trapped.

optionalfeature.name: Cultivate
entries: You may choose any of the following effects:

items: Grow a seed or a bush into a size large tree.
Create 2 fruits of hunger from a bush or 5 from a tree. An ancient fruit provides enough food an water for a day and last for a week without going bad.
Create a fruit of fertility from a bush or tree which contains 50 seeds which last fresh for a month.
From a piece of food, which is consumed, create a fungus of propagation, you may take a pound of spores from it.
Touching a tree create a simple object made out of wood, not larger than a 3ft cube. If the object is complex in nature you may require proficiency in Artisan's Tools to make it.

optionalfeature.name: Ancient Tools

item: A weapon created by monk's shillelagh

entries: Touching a weapon that has been created with Monk's Shillelagh you enhance its power for the duration, growing a blade made from white wood out of your staff, transforming it into a live scythe. Your weapon and technics now deal an extra 1d6 magic bludgeoning damage. You may use {@b Extending Vines}, {@b Caltrops's Spines} and {@b Wall of Plants} for free for the duration.

optionalfeature.name: Last Meal
entries: You throw a bag of spores to a creature 30ft. from you, the creature must succed a constitution saving throw against your spell save DC or become the food of a giant mushroom. If the creature fails it becomes stunned till the beginning of your next turn and receives 4d12 magic acid damage and 1d12 magic acid damage at the start of each of their turns for a minute. If it succeds it only takes 2d12 magic acid damage.

monster.name: Green Fist
senses: Has no senses, shares your knowledge of creature location.

trait.name: Ancient Link
entries: The Green Fist's Strenght score becomes your Wisdom score and the Dexterity score is your Dexterity score. It also shares your Proficiency Bonus.

trait.name: Massive
entries: The Green Fist may provide half cover.

monster.actionNote: Requires Your Bonus Action and 1 Ki point

action.name: Nature's Force
entries: {@atk mw} Finesse (Str or Dex plus PB), reach 5 ft., one target you can see. {@b Your martial arts dice x 3 + your wisdom modifier} magic bludgeoning damage.
If you casted this while holding your {@spell monk's shillelagh|Cos} weapon, any bonuses the weapon has apply to {@b Nature's Force} attack.
The damage of this ability increases by {@b one martial arts dice} if the Green Fist was casted from a tree and it increases again by {@b one martial arts dice} if you reach level 17.
